Messages.Author: Niko Ippendorf
Messages.Content: Dear students, I hope this message finds you well. Next week, the most of you will take the first written test. Therefore, I'm inviting you to our repetition and test preparation session tomorrow. You have the opportunity to ask both Prof. Dr zu Knyphausen-Aufseß and Prof. Dr Pidun your final questions regarding the course content. The session starts tomorrow at 10.15 am using Zoom Link. On ISIS, we additionally prepared an etherpad "Your questions for the written test" for you to write down last questions. Please make use of this possibility! Further, the points for your student presentation are now available on MOSES. Please check: Anmeldeübersicht > Details  The published points are your individual points. Since no group has asked for a peer assessment, the individual points correspond to the group results. Looking forward to seeing you tomorrow! Best regards, Niko Ippendorf

Messages.Author: Dodo Knyphausen-Aufseß
Messages.Content: Dear students, I would like to remind you that there will be five paper presentations tomorrow to introduce you to possible Master's theses (see Syllabus). The presenters will certainly be pleased to have more interested fellow students in the audience and their contributions to the discussion. Student Presentation | Academic Papers H 0110 | 9.30 (sharp!) am to 2 pm  Presentations | 9.30 am to 11.30 am AP 1 I Competitive Advantage AP 2 I Ecocentric Management AP 3 | Strategy in the Age of Sustainability  Presentations | 12.30 noon to 2 pm AP 4 | Digital Strategy AP 5 | Digital Economy  Best regards, Dodo zu Knyphausen-Aufseß

Messages.Author: Niko Ippendorf
Messages.Content: Dear students,  I'm reminding you on our Business Ecosystem Game on Friday, 28 June 2024.  If you want to participate, please conduct the Survey | Participation in the BES Game by Wednesday, 19 June 2024, midnight.  Since the organisation of the game depends on the number of participants, a binding registration is necessary.  Best regards, Niko Ippendorf

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Part 2: Business Ecosystems and Presentation Deadline

Messages.Author: Niko Ippendorf
Messages.Content: Dear students, I hope this message finds you well. We have successfully completed the first part of our module. This Friday, 7 June 2024, we will start with part 2: Business ecosystems (BES). Therefore, we welcome Prof. Dr Ulrich Pidun. This part is structured as four all-day block sessions; we start at 9 am (sharp!) until 4 pm (lunch break included).  The sessions are organised as follows: Friday, 7 June 2024, 9 am: Introduction to BES and BES design Friday, 14 June 2024, 9 am: BES failure and Governance Friday, 21 June 2024, 9 am: BES strategy and Capabilities Friday, 28 June: BES game Regarding your student presentations, please don't miss the upload deadline! All groups have to submit their files by Thursday, 6 June 2024, midnight! Only use the ISIS upload: Student presentation submission. Files delivered by e-mail will not be taken into account!  For your respective presentation date, please check the weekly overview on ISIS.  Please note, attendance is mandatory; it is not possible to change the presentation date or time!  We wish you good luck and looking forward to seeing you on Friday!  Best regards, Niko Ippendorf

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Important: BES Schedule Changes (incl. Presentation Dates)

Messages.Author: Niko Ippendorf
Messages.Content: Dear students, I hope this message finds you well. Due to a short-term room booking by the TU Berlin, we have to switch the two sessions on 21 and 28 June 2024! Here are the new dates: 21 June 2024 H 0110, 9 am (sharp!) to 4 pm Session 7 | Ecosystem Strategy and Capabilities and Organization Session 8 | Future of Business Ecosystems This session includes the following case studies: CS 9 I IoT ecosystems (GE vs. Siemens) CS 10 I Ecosystem organization (Haier) This is, the groups CS 9 and CS 10 will present on 21 June 2024, 1 pm to 2.30 pm and not on 28 June 2024!  28 June 2024 H 2036, 9 am (sharp!) to 4 pm  Business Ecosystem Game Game 1: 9 am to 11.45 am; game 2: 12.15 noon to 4 pm All changes are available on ISIS. Please check the weekly schedule. The syllabus is not up to date! The other two block sessions on 7 and 14 June 2024 and the presentation submission deadline on 6 June 2024 midnight are not effected by any changes.  We regret this unforeseen change of schedule and thank you for your support in ensuring that the sessions run smoothly.  Best regards, Niko Ippendorf

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Today: Annika von Mutius as our guest speaker!

Messages.Author: Dodo Knyphausen-Aufseß
Messages.Content: Dear All: Do not forget: Today, in our final session of the first half of the semester, you can experience pure female entrepreneurial power -- we have Annika von Mutius as our guest, co-founder of the Berlin-based AI company Empion. I look forward seeing you and hearing your questions!

Messages.Author: Niko Ippendorf
Messages.Content: Dear students, I hope this message finds you well. Today, some students asked about where to find the guiding questions for the student presentation. We assigned individual guiding questions to each group depending on the topic. Therefore check: Student presentation database > Scroll to your topic > Click the magnifying glass for details  Here you may also access your starting materials.  Best regards, Niko Ippendorf

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Group Selection - Closing Today at Midnight

Messages.Author: Niko Ippendorf
Messages.Content: Dear students, Today is your last chance to select a presentation topic/group! The "Student presentation selection" will close at midnight - and not all registered students have signed up for a group yet. Please note: Students who do not select a presentation group cannot participate in the presentation! Further, a group must consist of at least 4 members. We will re-organise smaller groups during the weekend. Thus, please check your final group on Monday. You may connect with your fellow group members using the "Group Chat": Select: "Separate Groups" > "My Group" Best regards, Niko Ippendorf

Messages.Author: Dodo Knyphausen-Aufseß
Messages.Content: Hey students, I just don't get it -- yesterday at the Zoom session there were almost 60 participants and at the end of the session I asked you to come today because our guest, director of a major energy company, is getting up at 5am to be in the classroom on time discuss with us. However, there were only about 30 students present today (many thanks to them!). Perhaps I need to learn that you are not interested in such practical input and change my teaching program accordingly. I would find that a great pity myself -- I think these inputs are very helpful to really understand and apply the academic material. I don't rule out the possibility that I will ask questions about the content of today's course in the written exam, and I will take the same approach in future courses with practitioners. Best regards, Dodo zu Knyphausen-Aufseß

Messages.Author: Dodo Knyphausen-Aufseß
Messages.Content: Dear All: Tomorrow we have our discussion with Dr. Atif Askar, Head of Business Development, Strategy and M&A at Traton SE. Don't forget: It's via Zoom. Our Wednesday session with Dr. Malte Kuss, Head of Controlling & Risk Management at RWE, is in-presence, I look forward seeing you then in the class room. Best regards, Dodo zu Knyphausen-Aufseß

Messages.Author: Niko Ippendorf
Messages.Content: Dear students,  If you are not registered for the portfolio examination (MOSES) but you want to participate in the class, please join the guest list and register as "visitors". So you can access the lecture materials. By the end of the month, we will remove all students from this ISIS course who are either not registered on MOSES or not registered as visitors at the guest list. Best regards, Niko Ippendorf

Messages.Author: Niko Ippendorf
Messages.Content: Dear students,  This message (guest list) is only addressed to students who are not registered on MOSES, to enable them to follow the lecture without participating in the exam.  If you are registered on MOSES, ignore this message and select a group/topic starting tomorrow 10 am!  We ask for your understanding that no further individual inquiries regarding registration or group selection can be answered. All information are available on ISIS!  Best regards, Niko Ippendorf

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Student Presentation Selection - Start Friday 10 am

Messages.Author: Niko Ippendorf
Messages.Content: Dear students, I hope this message finds you well. After your official exam registration on MOSES, we have added all registered students to two respective ISIS groups regarding the 1st and 2nd written test. Please check whether you are member of one of the two groups. The student presentation selection starts at Friday, 3 May 2024 at 10 am. Please select a topic (group) for conducting this part of the portfolio examniation. You can access your full starting materials as soon as you are part of a presentation group. Best regards, Niko Ippendorf

Messages.Author: Dodo Knyphausen-Aufseß
Messages.Content: Dear All: Don't forget that tomorrow we have our first practitioner conversation (with Dr. v. Pentz, John Deere) and that this session will be held via Zoom. You find the Zoom link on ISIS. I look forward to your participation -- my hope is that this conversation really deepens the corporate change topic you heard about in our today's session. Best regards, Dodo zu Knyphausen-Aufseß

Messages.Author: Dodo Knyphausen-Aufseß
Messages.Content: Dear students, the semester break is coming to an end, next week lectures will start again! I am pleased that you have registered for our "Strategic Management" module and that we will probably see each other for the first time next Tuesday (H1058, 10-12 a.m.). It would be good if you have already read through the syllabus and downloaded the slide set for "Lecture 1 Introduction to Strategic Management" (and perhaps also our "Introduction to the Module") so that you are familiar with the lecture). Best regards, Dodo zu Knyphausen-Aufseß

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Entry Game, Game Theory Lecture 1, slide 2

Messages.Author: Fabian Merlin Hespeler
Messages.Content: Hey,  I was wondering: on the second slide of the introduction slides (lecture 1), regarding the entry game. I believe that the numbers in the decision tree are mixed because it says that if the incumbent (Player 2) accommodates, the shares are [-1;1] and if the incumbent decides to fight the shares are [2;2]. Isn´t it the other way round, that when the incumbent decides to accomodate, the shares are equal compared to a fight, where both lose but the incumbent slightly less than the entrant? Thanks and regards, Fabian

Messages.Author: Niko Ippendorf
Messages.Content: Dear Fabian,  Contentwise, your analysis is correct. However, in this example: F = friendly response; A = agressive response.  Best regards, Niko Ippendorf
